userStories.title: Validation Engine Core
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a validation engine that can check props against schemas so that I catch configuration errors at dev time.
acceptanceCriteria: Validator can check required fields and report missing ones
Validator can check types (string, number, table, function, boolean)
Validator can check enum values against allowed list
Validator detects unknown properties
Validator suggests corrections for typos using string similarity

userStories.title: Component Schemas
userStories.description: As a developer, I want prop schemas defined for all UI components so that the validator knows what to check.
acceptanceCriteria: Schema exists for all primitive components (text, image, anim, spacer)
Schema exists for all layout components (vbox, hbox, root, padding)
Schema exists for all interactive components (button, spriteButton)
Schema exists for panel components (spritePanel with borders/decorations)
Each schema defines required fields, optional fields, and types

userStories.title: Strict API Entry Point
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to access strict validation via dsl.strict.* so that I can opt-in to validation without changing existing code.
acceptanceCriteria: dsl.strict.vbox, dsl.strict.hbox, dsl.strict.text etc. are accessible
Strict functions validate props before delegating to regular DSL
Errors include component name, property name, and file location
Errors include 'Did you mean?' suggestions for typos
Regular dsl.* functions remain unchanged (no breaking changes)

userStories.title: Test Runner Core
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a test runner that can execute describe/it blocks so that I can write and run tests.
acceptanceCriteria: describe() and it() functions are available for test structure
Tests report pass/fail with clear output
Failed tests show assertion details and stack traces
Runner can execute all tests in a directory
Runner exits with appropriate exit code (0 for pass, 1 for fail)

userStories.title: Test Matchers
userStories.description: As a developer, I want expect() matchers so that I can write expressive test assertions.
acceptanceCriteria: expect(x).to_be(y) for equality checks
expect(x).to_contain(y) for string/table containment
expect(x).to_be_truthy() and to_be_falsy()
expect(x).to_throw() for error checking
expect(x).to_equal(y) for deep table equality
Failed matchers show expected vs actual values

userStories.title: Test Runner Features
userStories.description: As a developer, I want advanced test runner features so that I can iterate quickly.
acceptanceCriteria: Filter tests by name pattern (e.g., --filter 'vbox')
Watch mode re-runs tests on file changes
Verbose mode shows all assertion details
Timing stats show duration per test and total
Summary shows passed/failed/skipped counts

userStories.title: Standalone Test Execution
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests to run without the game engine so that CI can validate changes quickly.
acceptanceCriteria: Tests can run via standalone Lua interpreter
Mock/stub layer provides minimal DSL simulation
Test suite completes in under 5 seconds
Works in GitHub Actions CI environment
Clear error if game-only features are accidentally used

userStories.title: Primitive Component Tests
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for all primitive UI components so that I have confidence in basic building blocks.
acceptanceCriteria: Tests for dsl.strict.text (content, fontSize, color, align)
Tests for dsl.strict.image (sprite, size, tint)
Tests for dsl.strict.anim (sprite, frames, speed)
Tests for dsl.strict.spacer (width, height)
Each test validates both valid and invalid prop combinations

userStories.title: Layout Component Tests
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for all layout UI components so that I have confidence in composition.
acceptanceCriteria: Tests for dsl.strict.vbox (children, spacing, align)
Tests for dsl.strict.hbox (children, spacing, align)
Tests for dsl.strict.root (config, children)
Tests for nested layouts (vbox inside hbox)
Tests validate children is required and must be array

userStories.title: Interactive Component Tests
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests for interactive UI components so that I have confidence in user interactions.
acceptanceCriteria: Tests for dsl.strict.button (onClick, children, disabled)
Tests for dsl.strict.spriteButton (sprite, borders, onClick)
Tests validate onClick is a function when provided
Tests for hover states and disabled states
Tests for spritePanel with decorations array

userStories.title: Showcase Gallery Viewer
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a gallery viewer so that I can browse UI examples visually.
acceptanceCriteria: Gallery displays list of available showcases by category
Selecting a showcase shows visual preview
Source code is displayed alongside preview
Keyboard navigation (up/down to browse, enter to select)
Categories: primitives, layouts, patterns

userStories.title: Primitive Showcases
userStories.description: As a developer, I want showcase examples for primitive components so that I can learn by example.
acceptanceCriteria: Showcase for text with various sizes, colors, alignments
Showcase for image with sizing and tinting
Showcase for anim with different frame rates
Showcase for spacer usage in layouts
Each showcase includes prop documentation comments

userStories.title: Layout Showcases
userStories.description: As a developer, I want showcase examples for layout components so that I can understand composition.
acceptanceCriteria: Showcase for vbox with various spacing and alignment
Showcase for hbox with various spacing and alignment
Showcase for nested layouts (complex compositions)
Showcase for root with different config options
Each showcase demonstrates common patterns

userStories.title: Pattern Showcases
userStories.description: As a developer, I want showcase examples for common UI patterns so that I can copy proven solutions.
acceptanceCriteria: Showcase for tooltip pattern
Showcase for modal/dialog pattern
Showcase for inventory grid pattern
Showcase for button with icon and label
Showcase for panel with decorations

userStories.title: API Reference Documentation
userStories.description: As a developer, I want LuaDoc comments on all DSL functions so that I can see docs in my editor.
acceptanceCriteria: All dsl.strict.* functions have LuaDoc comments
Comments document all parameters with types
Comments include usage examples
Comments note which fields are required vs optional
Enum fields list all valid values

userStories.title: Usage Guide Documentation
userStories.description: As a developer, I want Markdown guides so that I can understand the system holistically.
acceptanceCriteria: Guide: Getting started with dsl.strict
Guide: Writing UI tests
Guide: Using the showcase gallery
Guide: Adding new components to the strict system
All guides in docs/ui/ directory
